hints_html:
For \(f\) to be a probability density function it needs to satisfy two conditions:

  • \(f\)(x) \(\geq\) 0 for all x,

  • \(\int_{-\infty}^\infty f(x)\,dx = 1.\)

Choose k such that both conditions are fulfilled.

\item

\item

hints_raw:
For &fnof; to be a probability density function it needs to satisfy two conditions:

* &fnof;(x) &ge; 0 for all ''x'',
* <math> \int_{-\infty}^\infty f(x)\,dx = 1. </math>

Choose ''k'' such that both conditions are fulfilled.
question: 7 (a)
sols_html:
First, note that cos(x/10) \(\geq\) 0 and sin(x/10) \(\geq\) 0 for any 0 \(\leq\) x \(\leq\) 5\(\pi\). Hence we need k \(\geq\) 0 as well.

To satisfy the second condition we require

\[\begin{aligned} 1 = \int_{-\infty}^\infty f(x)\,dx = \int_0^{5\pi} k\cos\left(\frac{x}{10}\right) \sin^2\left(\frac{x}{10}\right)\,dx.\end{aligned}\]

The integral can easily be solved using the substitution u = sin(x/10), du = 1/10 cos(x/10), so that u(0) = 0 and u(5\(\pi\)) = sin(\(\pi\)/2) = 1. Hence we need to choose k such that

\[\begin{aligned} 1 &= \int_0^{5\pi} k\cos\left(\frac{x}{10}\right) \sin^2\left(\frac{x}{10}\right)\,dx \\ &= \int_0^1 10ku^2\,du \\ &= \left.\frac{10ku^3}3\right|_0^1 \\ &= \frac{10}3 k\end{aligned}\]

Hence we choose”’ k = 3/10. ”’

statement_html:
The length of time in minutes it takes students to solve a certain mathematics problem (on probability) is a continuous random variable whose probability density function is

\[\begin{aligned} f(x) = \begin{cases} k\cos(x/10)\sin^2(x/10), & \text{if } 0 \leq x \leq 5\pi, \\ 0, & \text{otherwise.} \end{cases}\end{aligned}\]

(a) Find the value of the positive constant \(k\).
